page.title: 17A Church in Milnathort
page.content: {The United Free Church of Scotland (U.F.Church) has one building in this area. It is right in the middle of the village and has a tall spire, stone built, that can be seen for miles around. This church looks very grand, but it is in need of a little repair and renovation. There is only a very small congregation, and they cannot afford to keep the building as nice as it should be. Only about a dozen people attend each Sunday morning service. To help make money to pay for heating a scrap paper collection is kept going all year. They also hold coffee mornings and sales of work. The flower-beds and lawns round this church are kept neat and tidy. Most Milnathort people are members of Orwell Church of Scotland, which is on the hill at the top of North Street
